snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan said that he believed his country and China had taken a major step forward in repairing relations, although the official Chinese reaction after the meeting was less optimistic.
abstract: Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe praises improvement in relations with China, saying he expects frequent dialog between nations in future; comments are first since his meeting with Chinese Pres Xi Jinping.
lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan said that he believed his country and China had taken a major step forward in repairing relations, although the official Chinese reaction after the meeting was less optimistic.

headline.main: Japanese Leader Cites Improved Ties With Beijing
headline.print_headline: Japanese Leader Cites Improved Ties With Beijing
